intro: Senecio forsteri, commonly known as the Forster's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green leaves, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypsela. Senecio forsteri is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
